what are ya trying to do, and when does it fail?

well I've tried the tested method of 1) renaming the repos to karmic, mounting the karmic iso and running cdinstall. The procedure failed because ubuntu could not authenticate a massive slew of packets (probably) all.
he did not have a separate partition for his /home, so I taught him howto targzip his /home dir and split it into DVDR-sized chunks.
try the server upgrade, if that doesn't work new install and copy home from backup

then install from new and restore from backup.. worst case delete the kde/gnome home dir and let it recreate it
that's exactly why I taught him to zip his /home dir and split it.
